title: Data Scientist
text:
A data scientist manages and cleans data, performs analyses, and communicates results, often collaborating with content specialists. From my experience at a Contract Research Organization (CRO), Iâ€™ve observed that Statistical Programmers align with both data scientists and statisticians.
Similarities:
-Knowledge of programming languages
-Strong statistical background
-Performing analyses
-Producing clear results
Differences:
Statisticians may have a more theoretical focus and are often more involved in experimental design. I currently view myself as more of a data scientist than a statistician.



y<-density(iris$Petal.Width)





#Class
class(y)

[1] "density"

#Type
typeof(y)

[1] "list"

#Structure
str(y)

List of 8
 $ x         : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y         : num [1:512] 0.00161 0.00178 0.00197 0.00217 0.00239 ...
 $ bw        : num 0.252
 $ n         : int 150
 $ old.coords: logi FALSE
 $ call      : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name : chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na    : logi FALSE
 - attr(*, "class")= chr "density"
